definitions.definition: To assign a duty or responsibility to; to order.
To assign (a debit ) to an account .
To require payment (of) (a price or fee, for goods, services, etc.).
examples: I won't charge you for the wheat.

definitions.definition: To pay on account, as by using a credit card .
examples: Can I charge my purchase to my credit card?

definitions.definition: To sell (something) at a given price .
examples: to charge coal at $5 per unit

definitions.definition: To formally accuse (a person) of a crime .
examples: I'm charging you with assault and battery.

definitions.definition: To call to account ; to challenge .
To place a burden , load or responsibility on or in.

subdefinitions.definition: To ornament with or cause to bear .
examples: to charge an architectural member with a moulding

subdefinitions.definition: To add to or represent on.
examples: He charges his shield with three roses or.

definitions.definition: To load equipment with material required for its use, as a firearm with powder, a fire hose with water, a chemical reactor with raw materials.

subdefinitions.definition: To cause to take on an electric charge .
examples: Rubbing amber with wool will charge it quickly.

subdefinitions.definition: To replenish energy to (a battery, or a device containing a battery) by use of an electrical device plugged into a power outlet.
examples: Don't forget to charge the drill.
I charge my phone every night.
The battery is still charging : I can't use it yet.
His cell phone charges very quickly, whereas mine takes forever.
labels: of a battery or a device containing a battery
subdefinitions.label_groups: intransitive , of a battery or a device containing a battery

definitions.definition: To move forward quickly and forcefully , particularly in combat and/or on horseback .

subdefinitions.definition: To attack by moving forward quickly in a group .
examples: The impetuous corps charged the enemy lines.

subdefinitions.definition: To take a few steps down the pitch towards the bowler as they deliver the ball, either to disrupt the length of the delivery, or to get into a better position to hit the ball.

definitions.definition: To lie on the belly and be still. ( A command given by a hunter to a dog )

main_definition: To assign a duty or responsibility to; to order.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To assign (a debit ) to an account .
( ambitransitive ) To require payment (of) (a price or fee, for goods, services, etc.).
( transitive , chiefly US ) To pay on account, as by using a credit card .
( transitive , dated ) To sell (something) at a given price .
( transitive , criminal law , law enforcement ) To formally accuse (a person) of a crime .
( transitive , property law ) To mortgage (a property).
To call to account ; to challenge .
( transitive ) To place a burden , load or responsibility on or in.
( transitive ) To load equipment with material required for its use, as a firearm with powder, a fire hose with water, a chemical reactor with raw materials.
( intransitive ) To move forward quickly and forcefully , particularly in combat and/or on horseback .
( transitive , of a hunting dog ) To lie on the belly and be still. ( A command given by a hunter to a dog )
